Borel? A related question is: Given a definition of a set in second order arithmetic, how can we tell that there is not an easier definition (in the sense that it uses less quantifier changes, no function quantifiers etc.)? The notion of
for classes in Polish spaces provides a general method to answer such questions.

children.value: It follows that complete sets exist for all levels of the Borel and projective hierarchy. However, the universal sets they are based on are rather abstract objects. Complete sets are most useful when we can show that a
implies completeness. We will encounter next an important example for the class of co-analytic sets.

## Uniformization

Two important structural properties of pointclasses are **separation** and **uniformization**.

We have seen an instance of separation in
